trans-unit.source: On the title describe what you've fixed (or created) with this Pull Request (PR).
trans-unit.target: On the title describe what you've fixed (or created) with this Pull Request (PR).

trans-unit.source: Insert a short (one or two sentence) summary here.
trans-unit.target: Insert a short (one or two sentence) summary here.

trans-unit.source: Note: The "Fixes #nnn" syntax in the PR description causes GitHub to automatically close the issue when this PR is merged.
trans-unit.target: Note: The "Fixes #nnn" syntax in the PR description causes GitHub to automatically close the issue when this PR is merged.

trans-unit.source: Remove that line if you don't have issues associated with this PR.
trans-unit.target: Remove that line if you don't have issues associated with this PR.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Guidelines for Contributing link above for details.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Guidelines for Contributing link above for details.

trans-unit.source: Explain your changes, and why you made them.
trans-unit.target: Explain your changes, and why you made them.

trans-unit.source: If that information is already available in the issue referenced above, just referencing the issue is preferred to copying the text.
trans-unit.target: If that information is already available in the issue referenced above, just referencing the issue is preferred to copying the text.

trans-unit.source: This may not be necessary depending on the scope of the PR changes.
trans-unit.target: This may not be necessary depending on the scope of the PR changes.

trans-unit.source: For example, "fix typo in introduction.md" is sufficient to describe that PR.
trans-unit.target: For example, "fix typo in introduction.md" is sufficient to describe that PR.

trans-unit.source: If you know who should review this, use '@' to request a review.
trans-unit.target: If you know who should review this, use '@' to request a review.
